user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_set_connection_value_n_nocheck_:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
MHD_set_connection_value_n_nocheck_ (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                                     enum MHD_ValueKind kind,
                                     const char *key,
                                     size_t key_size,
                                     const char *value,
                                     size_t value_size)
{
  struct MHD_HTTP_Req_Header *pos;

  pos = MHD_connection_alloc_memory_ (connection,
                                      sizeof (struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header));
  if (NULL == pos)
    return MHD_NO;
  pos->header = key;
  pos->header_size = key_size;
  pos->value = value;
  pos->value_size = value_size;
  pos->kind = kind;
  pos->next = NULL;
  /* append 'pos' to the linked list of headers */
  if (NULL == connection->rq.headers_received_tail)
  {
    connection->rq.headers_received = pos;
    connection->rq.headers_received_tail = pos;
  }
  else
  {
    connection->rq.headers_received_tail->next = pos;
    connection->rq.headers_received_tail = pos;
  }
  return MHD_YES;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (NULL == connection->rq.headers_received_tail)
  {
    connection->rq.headers_received = pos;
    connection->rq.headers_received_tail = pos;
  }
  else
  {
    connection->rq.headers_received_tail->next = pos;
    connection->rq.headers_received_tail = pos;
  }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 14.3 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation — the controlling expression (NULL == connection->rq.headers_received_tail) is not an invariant. Its truth depends on the runtime state of the connection structure (pointer value may change), so it is not an integer constant or compile-time constant. The rule 14.3 exceptions are not needed here.
